description:
Hi,

It seems that EC2 API is not started when running service nova-api start. There are no errors in the logs, but the line indicating the service start:
2011-11-11 08:48:06,145 AUDIT nova [-] Starting /usr/bin/nova-api on 0.0.0.0:8773
is missing from the logs.
All I see in the logs is:
2011-11-11 10:56:30,502 DEBUG nova [-] ec2_port : 8773 from (pid=15646) wait /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/service.py:383
2011-11-11 10:56:30,504 DEBUG nova [-] ec2_listen_port : 8773 from (pid=15646) wait /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/service.py:383

Nova is listening on port 8774, but not on 8773.
telnet localhost 8773
Trying 127.0.0.1...
telnet: Unable to connect to remote host: Connection refused

Here is my nova.conf:
--dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
--dhcpbridge=/usr/bin/nova-dhcpbridge
--logdir=/var/log/nova
--state_path=/var/lib/nova
--lock_path=/var/lock/nova
--use_deprecated_auth
--allow_admin_api=true
--verbose
--s3_host=10.30.1.26
--rabbit_host=10.30.1.26
--host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_dmz_host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_path=/services/Cloud
--ec2_port=8773
--ec2_scheme=http
--fixed_range=10.5.1.0/12
--network_size=8
--FAKE_subdomain=ec2
--routing_source_ip=10.30.1.26
--sql_connection=mysql://root:***@localhost/nova
title: nova-api not starting the EC2 API in 2012.1-dev

comments.content:
Hi,

It seems that EC2 API is not started when running service nova-api start. There are no errors in the logs, but the line indicating the service start:
2011-11-11 08:48:06,145 AUDIT nova [-] Starting /usr/bin/nova-api on 0.0.0.0:8773
is missing from the logs.
All I see in the logs is:
2011-11-11 10:56:30,502 DEBUG nova [-] ec2_port : 8773 from (pid=15646) wait /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/service.py:383
2011-11-11 10:56:30,504 DEBUG nova [-] ec2_listen_port : 8773 from (pid=15646) wait /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/service.py:383

Nova is listening on port 8774, but not on 8773.
telnet localhost 8773
Trying 127.0.0.1...
telnet: Unable to connect to remote host: Connection refused

Here is my nova.conf:
--dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
--dhcpbridge=/usr/bin/nova-dhcpbridge
--logdir=/var/log/nova
--state_path=/var/lib/nova
--lock_path=/var/lock/nova
--use_deprecated_auth
--allow_admin_api=true
--verbose
--s3_host=10.30.1.26
--rabbit_host=10.30.1.26
--host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_dmz_host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_host=10.30.1.26
--ec2_path=/services/Cloud
--ec2_port=8773
--ec2_scheme=http
--fixed_range=10.5.1.0/12
--network_size=8
--FAKE_subdomain=ec2
--routing_source_ip=10.30.1.26
--sql_connection=mysql://root:***@localhost/nova
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gregor-beslic

comments.content: I have the same issue with 2012.1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ghe.rivero

comments.content:
Same issue for me, but I've got version 2011.3 (2011.3-nova-milestone-tarball:tarmac-20110922115702-k9nkvxqzhj130av2)

That's wierd, because a few days ago, nova-api worked great
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikemowgli

comments.content: sorry, my bad: I forgot a flag "enabled_apis=osapi". That caused the ec2 api not to run. This means for 2011.3, the problem does not occur.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikemowgli
